Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he plans to take to implement the recommendations made by Professor Harrington in his final report on the work capability assessment in November 2012.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What recent assessment he has made of the new enterprise allowance.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What financial support his Department makes available to sick and disabled people while their claim for employment and support allowance undergoes mandatory reconsideration prior to the formal appeal.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the arrangements for offshore safety inspections in the North Sea.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the effects of planned changes to the state pension on women born between April 1952 and April 1953.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: How many households in Wales have been affected by the under-occupancy penalty to date.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What recent estimate he has made of the number of people in full-time employment.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he plans to take to restrict access to benefits for new migrants from other EU member states.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he is taking to help pensioners.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the preparedness of the universal credit IT delivery system.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he is taking to publicise the potential effects of planned regulation changes on claimants currently in receipt of (a) the disability living allowance higher rate and (b) Motability cars.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the effect of sanctions on jobseeker's allowance claimants.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What redress is available to tenants whose landlords seek to evict them on the grounds that they are housing benefit recipients subject to the benefits cap.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he is taking to reduce the eligibility to UK benefits of nationals of other EU member states.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he is taking to support credit unions.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of whether people who claim disability-related benefits are also more likely to receive housing benefit; and if he will make a statement.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of his Department's counter-fraud activities.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What steps he is taking to help separated parents work together in the best interests of their children.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the effect of the under-occupancy penalty to date; and if he will make a statement.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the implementation of the personal independence payment to date.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What recent assessment he has made of the new enterprise allowance.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the level of competition in the UK pension fund management industry.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: Which groups will benefit from the reforms to the state pension planned for 2016.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: What assessment he has made of the introduction of the universal credit pathfinder.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.

Question.Department: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions
Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.

Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.

Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.

Question.Text: If he will make a statement on his Departmental responsibilities.
